poem:
**Executive Pens**

Over the Oval's oak  
drifts the ghost of ink,  
autopen whispers  
seep between corridors—  
spectral signatures  
floating like autumn leaves,  
a silence amid raucous claims,  
while beneath, the Resolute rests,  
its wood familiar with history's weight,  
listening to the hum of  
politics, the murmurs of  
lingering pens.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Trump news at a glance: president goes after Biden executive orders with baseless autopen claims Donald Trump has declared he intends to cancel most of the executive orders signed by Joe Biden, his predecessor as president of the United States. In a post on social media, Trump claimed baselessly that Biden had not signed off on the orders himself, saying that “the radical left lunatics circling Biden around the beautiful Resolute Desk in the Oval". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
